question: [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: process_transactions()] [Current balance deduplication] At line 312, extend() overwrites earlier entries - if the same account has multiple balance changes in one batch, does only the last one get recorded or all intermediate states? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: process_transactions()] [HashMap to Vec conversion] At lines 316-322, HashMaps are converted to Vecs via into_values() which loses insertion order - can this cause non-deterministic ordering affecting database inserts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: process_transactions()] [Sorting stability] At lines 325-332, data is sorted before insertion - is the sort stable, and can equal elements be ordered non-deterministically across runs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: process_transactions()] [Account transaction deduplication] At line 320-322, account_transactions HashMap is converted to Vec - can duplicate (transaction_version, account_address) pairs exist before conversion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Trait: TransactionProcessor] [Name collision] At line 269-271, the processor name is hardcoded as 'coin_processor' - can multiple instances with the same name cause conflicts in shared databases? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: connection_pool()] [Pool sharing] At line 361-363, the connection pool is exposed - can other code acquire connections and hold them indefinitely starving the processor? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: process_transactions()] [Version range validation] Start_version and end_version parameters are logged but not validated - can invalid ranges (start > end) cause undefined behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: process_transactions()] [Batch size limits] No explicit limit on transactions.len() - can extremely large batches cause memory exhaustion or timeout issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: get_conn()] [Connection acquisition] Line 279 calls get_conn() without timeout - can database unavailability cause the processor to hang indefinitely? (Medium)
